overview_of_class: Learn different sociological theories about cities and social life and about research that supports or revises those theories. Topics include physical ecology of cities, political economy of cities, social life among social groups, and the question of community, deviance and social control, and planning for the future.
name: The City: Urbanization and Urbanism
title: WCAS SOCIOL 301-0-20 The City: Urbanization and Urbanism
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-registration is reserved for Sociology Majors and Minors.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Learn different sociological theories about cities and social life and about research that supports or revises those theories. Topics include physical ecology of cities, political economy of cities, social life among social groups, and the question of community, deviance and social control, and planning for the future.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
During preregistration this course is only open to Sociology Majors & Minors.
This course is open to all undergraduates during regular registration.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
major theories of urbanization

social patterns of class, racial and ethnic segregation and urban neighborhoods

social ties and consequences for communities

politics and development and planning for the future
